" [ The defendants ] , who belong to the GPE ’s Witnesses sect , attempted to proselytise and , directly or indirectly , to intrude on the religious beliefs of NORP , with the intention of undermining those beliefs , by taking advantage of their inexperience , their low intellect and their naïvety . CARDINAL . Mr and PERSON appealed against this judgment to ORG ( Efetio ) . ORG quashed PERSON conviction and upheld her husband ’s but reduced his prison sentence to DATE and converted it into a pecuniary penalty of CARDINAL drachmas per day . The following reasons were given for its judgment , which was delivered on CARDINAL DATE :

" ... it was proved that , with the aim of disseminating the articles of faith of the GPE ’s Witnesses sect ( airesi ) , to which the defendant adheres , he attempted , directly and indirectly , to intrude on the religious beliefs of a person of a different religious persuasion from his own , [ namely ] the NORP faith , with the intention of changing those beliefs , by taking advantage of her inexperience , her low intellect and her naïvety . More specifically , at the time and place indicated in the operative provision , he visited PERSON and after telling her he brought good news , pressed her to let him into the house , where he began by telling her about the politician PERSON and by expounding pacifist views . He then took out a little book containing professions of faith by adherents of the aforementioned sect and began to read out passages from Holy Scripture , which he skilfully analysed in a manner that the NORP woman , for want of adequate grounding in doctrine , could not challenge , and at the same time offered her various similar books and importunately tried , directly and indirectly , to undermine her religious beliefs . He must consequently be declared guilty of the above - mentioned offence , in accordance with the operative provision hereinafter , while the other defendant , his wife PERSON , must be acquitted , seeing that there is no evidence that she participated in the offence committed by her husband , whom she merely accompanied ... "
CARDINAL of the appeal judges dissented , and his opinion , which was appended to the judgment , read as follows :

" ... the first defendant should also have been acquitted , as none of the evidence shows that PERSON ... was particularly inexperienced in NORP doctrine , being married to a cantor , or of particularly low intellect or particularly naïve , such that the defendant was able to take advantage and ... [ thus ] induce her to become a member of the GPE ’s Witnesses sect . "
According to the record of the hearing of CARDINAL DATE , PERSON had given the following evidence :

" They immediately talked to me about PERSON , whether he was a pacifist or not , and other subjects that I ca n’t remember . They talked to me about things I did not understand very well . It was not a discussion but a constant monologue by them . ... If they had told me they were Jehovah ’s Witnesses , I would not have let them in . I do n’t recall whether they spoke to me about GPE . CARDINAL . PERSON appealed on points of law . He maintained , inter alia , that the provisions of PERSON no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL contravened LAW ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) .
CARDINAL . ORG ( PERSON ) dismissed the appeal on DATE . It rejected the plea of unconstitutionality for the following reasons :

" LAW no . DATE , substituted by LAW no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL providing for the implementation of CARDINAL and CARDINAL of the LAW and enacted under LAW then in force , LAW which prohibited proselytism and any other interference with the dominant religion in GPE , namely ORG , not only does not contravene LAW but is fully compatible with LAW , which recognises the inviolability of freedom of conscience in religious matters and provides for freedom to practise any known religion , subject to a formal provision in the same LAW prohibiting proselytism in that proselytism is forbidden in general whatever the religion against which it is directed , including therefore the dominant religion in GPE , in accordance with LAW , namely ORG . It also noted that ORG had given detailed reasons for its judgment and had complied with LAW in applying the impugned provisions .

In the opinion of a dissenting member , ORG should have quashed the judgment of the court below for having wrongly applied section CARDINAL of Law no . CARDINAL in that it had made no mention of the promises whereby the defendant had allegedly attempted to intrude on PERSON religious beliefs and had given no particulars of PERSON inexperience and low intellect .
CARDINAL . The relevant Articles of the DATE LAW read as follows :

" CARDINAL . The dominant religion in GPE is that of ORG . ORG , which recognises as its head Our Lord PERSON , is indissolubly united , doctrinally , with FAC of GPE and with any other ORG in communion with it ( omodoxi ) , immutably observing , like the other Churches , the holy apostolic and synodical canons and the holy traditions . It is autocephalous and is administered by ORG , composed of all the bishops in office , and by the standing ORG , which is an emanation of it constituted as laid down in GPE and in accordance with the provisions of LAW of DATE and LAW of DATE .
CARDINAL . The ecclesiastical regime in certain regions of the ORG shall not be deemed contrary to the provisions of the foregoing paragraph .
CARDINAL . The text of ORG is unalterable . No official translation into any other form of language may be made without the prior consent of the autocephalous ORG and ORG at GPE . "
" CARDINAL . Freedom of conscience in religious matters is inviolable . The enjoyment of personal and political rights shall not depend on an individual ’s religious beliefs .

CARDINAL . There shall be freedom to practise any known religion ; individuals shall be free to perform their rites of worship without hindrance and under the protection of the law . The performance of rites of worship must not prejudice public order or public morals . Proselytism is prohibited .
CARDINAL . The ministers of all known religions shall be subject to the same supervision by the ORG and to the same obligations to it as those of the dominant religion .
CARDINAL . No one may be exempted from discharging his obligations to the ORG or refuse to comply with the law by reason of his religious convictions .
CARDINAL . No oath may be required other than under a law which also determines the form of it . "

CARDINAL . ORG , which during DATE of foreign occupation symbolised the maintenance of NORP culture and the NORP language , took an active part in the NORP people ’s struggle for emancipation , to such an extent that NORP is to some extent identified with the NORP faith .

A royal decree of DATE entitled " Proclamation of the Independence of the Greek Church " described ORG as " autocephalous " . GPE ’s successive Constitutions have referred to the ORG as being " dominant " . The overwhelming majority of the population are members of it , and , according to NORP conceptions , it represents de jure and de facto the religion of the ORG itself , a good number of whose administrative and educational functions ( marriage and family law , compulsory religious instruction , oaths sworn by members of the Government , etc . ) it moreover carries out . Its role in public life is reflected by , among other things , the presence of the Minister of ORG and ORG at the sessions of the ORG hierarchy at which the Archbishop of GPE is elected and by the participation of the ORG authorities in all official ORG events ; the President of the Republic takes his oath of office according to NORP ritual ( Article CARDINAL para . CARDINAL of the LAW ) ; and the official calendar follows that of ORG .

CARDINAL . Under the reign of PERSON DATE ) , ORG , which had long complained of a Bible society ’s propaganda directed at young NORP schoolchildren on behalf of ORG , managed to get a clause added to LAW ( CARDINAL ) forbidding " proselytism and any other action against the dominant religion " . LAW , DATE and DATE reproduced the same clause . The DATE LAW prohibits proselytism in general ( Article CARDINAL para . CARDINAL in fine - see paragraph CARDINAL above ) : the ban covers all " known religions " , meaning those whose doctrines are not apocryphal and in which no secret initiation is required of neophytes .

CARDINAL . During the dictatorship of GPE ( DATE ) proselytism was made a criminal offence for the first time by LAW ( anagastikos nomos ) no . CARDINAL . DATE that section was amended by LAW no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , in which the meaning of the term " proselytism " was clarified :

" CARDINAL . Anyone engaging in proselytism shall be liable to imprisonment and a fine of CARDINAL ; he shall , moreover , be subject to police supervision for a period of DATE to be fixed by the court when convicting the offender .
The term of imprisonment may not be commuted to a fine .

CARDINAL . By ‘ proselytism’ is meant , in particular , any direct or indirect attempt to intrude on the religious beliefs of a person of a different religious persuasion ( eterodoxos ) , with the aim of undermining those beliefs , either by any kind of inducement or promise of an inducement or moral support or material assistance , or by fraudulent means or by taking advantage of his inexperience , trust , need , low intellect or naïvety .
CARDINAL . The commission of such an offence in a school or other educational establishment or a philanthropic institution shall constitute a particularly aggravating circumstance . "
CARDINAL . In a judgment numbered CARDINAL/CARDINAL a full court of ORG ( Symvoulio tis PERSON ) gave the following definition of proselytism :

" LAW , which establishes the freedom to practise any known religion and to perform rites of worship without hindrance and prohibits proselytism and all other activities directed against the dominant religion , that of ORG , means that purely spiritual teaching does not amount to proselytism , even if it demonstrates the errors of other religions and entices possible disciples away from them , who abandon their original religions of their own free will ; this is because spiritual teaching is in the nature of a rite of worship performed freely and without hindrance . Outside such spiritual teaching , which may be freely given , any determined , importunate attempt to entice disciples away from the dominant religion by means that are unlawful or morally reprehensible constitutes proselytism as prohibited by the aforementioned provision of LAW . "

CARDINAL . The NORP courts have held that persons were guilty of proselytism who had : likened the saints to " figures adorning the wall " , PERSON to " a body stuffed with cotton " and the ORG to " a theatre , a market , a cinema " ; preached , while displaying a painting showing a crowd of wretched people in rags , that " such are all those who do not embrace my faith " ( Court of Cassation , judgment no . CARDINAL , PERSON , p. CARDINAL ) ; promised NORP refugees housing on specially favourable terms if they adhered to the ORG faith ( ORG of the LOC , judgment no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , PERSON , p. CARDINAL ) ; offered a scholarship for study abroad ORG , judgment no . ORG followed it in an order ( voulevma ) numbered CARDINAL ( ORG , DATE , p. CARDINAL ) , adding that the expression " in particular " in CARDINAL of PERSON no . PERSON ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) referred to the means used by the person committing the offence and not to the description of the actus reus .

CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) as having no basis in law because , when convicting a GPE ’s Witness , ORG had merely reiterated the words of the indictment and had thus not explained how " the importunate teaching of the doctrines of the GPE ’s Witnesses sect " or " distribution of the sect ’s booklets at a minimal price " had amounted to an attempt to intrude on the ORG religious beliefs , or shown how the defendant had taken advantage of their " inexperience " and " low intellect " . Similarly , it has been held in several court decisions that the offence of proselytism was not made out where there had merely been a discussion about the beliefs of the Jehovah ’s Witnesses , where booklets had been distributed from door to door ( ORG , judgment no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) or in the street ( ORG , judgment no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) or where the tenets of the sect had been explained without any deception to an NORP ( ORG , judgment no . CARDINAL ) . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . After the revision of the LAW in DATE , the GPE ’s Witnesses brought legal proceedings to challenge the constitutionality of section CARDINAL of PERSON no . TIME .
